website_summaries.verdict: You can have fun with your stop rockets at night with this glow in the dark option.
pros: Shoots plenty high for most people to enjoy
Needs a smaller space for operation
Can be operated sufficiently by younger children
A good value on a stomp rocket toy that can deliver a lot of fun
cons: The stand is flimsy, but the toy still works and people enjoy it a lot, even without the stand

customer_reviews.title: Great item. No complaints. Perfect for kids of various ages.
customer_reviews.text: I bought even though the reviews complained about the poor quality of the stand... and I was SUPER happy to see that when the gift was opened it had a new and improved tripod stand with adjustable direction mount. FANTASTIC GIFT! 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kt J

customer_reviews.title: So much fun! The kids LOVE this and it provides a ...
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! The kids LOVE this and it provides a lot of entertainment! Even our 2.5 yr old has it figured out and enjoys shooting rockets all over the house and the park. Word of warning - stay away from trees. These delightful rockets are lightweight and once they're in a tree... good luck? We've only lost one, but it was sad. The stand is kind of hard to keep together, but I think using some tape to keep it together during a round of rockets would work OK.
customer_reviews.author: Megs814

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart on first stomp
customer_reviews.text: Horrible construction. It's all a bunch of cheap plastic that falls apart the minute you stomp. I can't for the life of me understand how the design of the base was supposed to stay together. It was a huge let down considering all the positive reviews and awards. My 2.5 year old does love this toy after I "fixed" it with a few zip ties. Not even worth the return.
customer_reviews.author: S. Huster

customer_reviews.title: Our boys love this
customer_reviews.text: What could be better than rockets shooting into the air for young boys? And our girls try not to act excited at first but they love it too. This gets rave reviews from my kids every time we use it. We don't put the stand on because it keeps falling apart. We use just the hose and air bag. We bought extra rockets since somebody always tries to stomp the bag harder and higher than others and forget to aim it straight up so the rockets sometimes end up on roofs and in fields. Easier to grab some extra rockets to stomp before heading off to search for the lost ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy - but be ready to glue the base.
customer_reviews.text: The little base stand is three pieces of molded, semi-ridged plastic. Which, for the toy's cost, is MORE than what you'd expect. But to make it something your kids will play with without constant "Daddy!"s in the background, be ready to apply a little Gorilla glue at the joinings of the three base "stand" pieces. The missiles are great, they really do glow in the dark (so we haven't lost one yet). My 4 year old and his 6 year old cousin haven't stopped stomping on it or playing with the missiles (without parental intervention and threats of grounding) since they open both of theirs at 7am on Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This is a poorly designed lightweight rocket that doesn't work well. I also bought the GeoSpace Jump Rocket Mini set which is less money and so much better. This was a waste of money the other one was grest. I ended up returning this and buying 2 more of the GeoSpace one.
customer_reviews.author: Shores Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Keeps kids entertained
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to get my kid outside & away from the tv during quarantine. He was so excited to receive this today. Easy to setup. It comes with 4 large “rockets”. He’s used the smaller ones before with the foam hand gun which is a similar concept to this product. Running & stomping is more fun + I rather have him send rockets into the air vs shoot foam launchers at people. With the smaller foam rockets we have they eventually lose the fins so I fully expect the same with the large ones. This won’t impact them launching but may impact the direction. Would I recommend, yes. It’s a simple toy that keeps kids entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Finally-a toy my kids play with for more than 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: This toy has provided hours of entertainment for my twin 3 year old boys and 7 year old daughter. They are cheap little products (I got three so there was no fighting), but have stood up to my kiddos just fine. They're simple and easy to use, and my kids love them! There are, however, a couple on our roof...so waiting for a strong wind to bring them down, lol! Tip: Aim away from your house rather than straight up so the wind doesn't take them onto your roof! Lucky it comes with 4 'rockets' per package!
customer_reviews.author: Zlo3d2

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble, then falls apart within a few uses
customer_reviews.text: The "stand" was almost impossible to put together and once assembled it held for maybe two or three launches before falling apart again. After a few rounds of that the adults in our group ended up holding the hoses for the kids instead. Luckily (?) the rest of the contraption broke over the next dozen or so launches so we were able to just throw the whole piece of junk away. The kids that were using the rockets were 2, 4, 5 and 6 and they didn't do anything wild or unreasonable. This product is just not made to withstand the slightest touch, counterproductive if you have to jump on it in order to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a way to get wiggles out during “social distancing” and it is fantastic. My kid stomps it and then chases after the rocket. He burns so much energy by himself and doesn’t think twice about it. It does launch high and sometimes unpredictable with wind so we only used it at an empty soccer field but we realized that the launcher can be set to an angle so he shoots it directly at the house or garage from a distance on days when we can’t get to a park. Rockets have held up thus far.
customer_reviews.author: mike d

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for a kid
customer_reviews.text: We got this for as a gift for a 5 year old. The kids played with it for hours and hours! It was fun to watch them play, they enjoyed it. Warning through, have something ready to knock it out of a tree if you have a kid that can really launch them! This is probably one of the best gifts I've seen given!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: One change makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these years ago.(same company, same name) We have used it for our grands and ourselves many, many times. Eventually the stand broke. I decided it was time for a new one. The stand on the new one seems to be better made. The only drawback is that the rockets only go straight up. With the old one, you could point the rocket in the direction you wanted to go. Which made it a lot more fun. That’s how we see it. Hopefully our grandkids will still enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Charm C

customer_reviews.title: Fun but flimsy without duct tape
customer_reviews.text: We use this with my 17 month old in the park, have her chase the rockets in the grass, she loves it. It is a cheap toy that will last for awhile now that I have put duct tape on it. It was flimsy when you slide it together and wouldn't stay together on our home floor, so I taped it and it works for us but if you need to pack it down flat then taping it isnt an option
customer_reviews.author: Raven the MavenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Every kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great for 3 year old, she took to it quickly and got some easy entertainment out of it. Was worried she would not have enough strength to stomp on it but that was not the case at all. She easily launched it 40-50 feet while someone older can get closer to that 100ft mark. Rockets may not hold up over time since it is just the normal Styrofoam you would expect. I imagine the fins will fall off first but still be usable. You can aim the launcher so it goes different angles.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials. Fun for an hour or two.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this and didn’t know what to expect. It felt and performed similar to what I would have paid 4-5 bucks for at a cheaper toy store. I felt like it was overpriced for what we got since the frame doesn’t stay assembled (or assemble well to begin with) and the wings on each rocket or glued instead of fitted so they tend to fall off easily. I wouldn’t pay the money for this again since it was “meh” fun and difficult to keep together with cheap materials
customer_reviews.author: Kelsie

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! Recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Despite few negative reviews stating that they were not sturdy and didn't stay well, I decided to buy this. Actually bought two of them (for 3 and 4 year-olds) and regretted that didn't get the third one for older kid (10 yrs old). They loved it, spent the weekend launching. Haven't even pulled the spare rockets. They fly great vertically and under different angles. It teaches kids different laws of physics while they are playing. Will buy more for our son's friends as gifts
customer_reviews.author: Yuriy Buha

customer_reviews.title: Love the stomp rocket!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd stomp rocket, first one we had was several years ago for a different child. All of my children have had so much fun with these. My older son got one when he was 5 or 6 and this one was for my 3 year old, they both loved it no matter the age. The fins do come off on occasion but the main stomping part of the toy is long lasting so it'll still be in good shape if you need to buy additional rockets. I think the pump and tube of our first one is still working actually and it's at least 4 or 5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: eeg

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy!
customer_reviews.text: This had been a fun gift for my 3 yr old friends. They mastered the operation in 5 minutes. After 10 minutes use, I made two alterations that keep the launch pad together and keep it aimed appropriately for indoor use. You can see my addition of zip ties in the photo. Two on the bottom (yellow ties) and one where the launcher is attached (green tie). It's been fun! Would buy it again for other small friends!
customer_reviews.author: Stefani

customer_reviews.title: Worked As Promised; Was A Hit as a Gift
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this but there's only so much play value, (but lots of mess), is those goofy old-fashioned vinegar and baking soda toys. Turns out this was a complete hit, and reasonably durable. Got the extra rockets because these fly high enough and far enough to be easy to lose and/or put on the roof. No batteries or fuel or ignition so even the youngest kids can fool with it. Easy to set up and playable right out of the box. The glow angle was neither here nor there, but that didn't matter since the rockets flew just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: One of the pieces was not in the box.  Great gift and lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 3 year grandson for Christmas. To our dismay, one crucial part was not in the box. It was the third leg of the tripod that the launcher attaches to. Fortunately, I had some thin plywood and was able to craft a replacement. Other than that, this was a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 3.5 year old grand daughter. She and I love this clever invention. We have put it through a major stomping 5 times with extra rockets. It performs incredible well. Grand daughter can shoot these rockets 60 feet in the air and 125 feet in length. We measured her 7 longest shots! Fun for all age levels and super good exercise for your kids.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy piece of junk, no way to tell from the package
customer_reviews.text: Look elsewhere for a sturdy stomp rocket blaster. This thing cannot take any abuse at all. The base, after "assembled" barely locks together at all, and either fell apart or tipped over, every other time one of my kids fired a rocket. I would of returned it, but since we didn't unpack it until we got on our camping trip, i fastened the 3 legs together with duct tape and just let them have at it. Further, the 4 rockets were smashed randomly into the box upon opening it; so all the fins were bent every which way and some of them were already starting to peel apart.
customer_reviews.author: wheeljack78

customer_reviews.title: Lot of fun for kid
customer_reviews.text: Fun and inexpensive toy to keep children busy. A lot of fun I must say as the launch pad can be adjusted to different angle. It shoots quite high; been tested in the backyard. Rocket is made out of very light foam, shot it to kid's tummy, and they only had laughter. By the way, the seller is quick and helpful in responding support. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my four-year old twins’ birthday and they love it! It is really sturdy and works great. My only complaint is the design of the stand for the launcher. It comes apart easily when little boys stomp on it. Otherwise, this was the perfect toy for them and the rockets are soft enough that they can launch them in the house without breaking the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Great, but the fins fall off and not too sure about the glow
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product like all the other reviewers have mentioned. Ease of use, does travel 100 + feet. However I have failed to notice the glow in this. I have used this at 10 pm when it was quite dark and didn't notice the glow. Also I've noticed that the fins fall off after repeated use. If I had to buy this again, I would save a few bucks and go for the cheaper version without the glow. But will definitely buy stomp rockets again.
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Good with proper landing space
customer_reviews.text: Good for the 4 year old set. Larger ones are available for older kids. If I were to do it over again I’d probably just pay the couple dollars more and get the full sized version. Still 5 stars though because the larger rocket would require a larger landing zone (or you’ll lose the rockets in trees, on roofs, etc) which lots of folks may not have. Would recommend going with as large a size rocket as you can accommodate in terms of launch zone. I’d say to figure the height of flight to be about the radius of your landing area.
customer_reviews.author: jkrispies

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not without challenges.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this toy! It’s kind of janky quality and I almost returned it because the stand doesn’t stand up. But if they hold the hose and stomp on the launcher it does work and it provides hours of laughter and fun yesterday. I do think it should be priced for much less it is pretty much a Dollar Tree quality toy.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Q

customer_reviews.title: The kids of all ages loved this toy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this many months before we actually gave it to the grandkids on 4th of July. It was the hit of the day! The kids of all ages loved this toy. Easy for even the smallest children to get some height to their rocket and when the BIG kids took their turn it was quite amazing how high the rockets would fly. They also did some aiming with their rockets trying to hit various objects...no damage because they are sturdy but soft. Kept everyone busy during that time when it was still too light for the real "rockets." Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: malcolm dalrymple

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad item. Bought the glow rocket and did not get the glow rocket. We got the plain rocket. While satisfied with the item just disappointed we didn’t get what we paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Mcmunn family

customer_reviews.title: The rockets are lightweight styrofoam that fly pretty nice when a kid jumps on the bladder thing ...
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this toy. The rockets are lightweight styrofoam that fly pretty nice when a kid jumps on the bladder thing hard. You can aim it at different angles, but we still managed to get one stuck on a roof. The wind blew it down the next day. It blew up & destroyed my neighbor’s car that it landed on. My kid kept putting things inside the bladder, though, when i has disassembled it & I wasn’t looking. Eventually, he filled it with crayons & other junk that I can’t get out without cuttin it apart & destroying it, so we’re done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Perry

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy, would recommend it beacuse probably nothing better exists for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm between a 3 and 4 here. It's a great toy for my 3 year old. He had a great time with it. The problem is the stand doesn't stay attached and when it falls apart it takes an adult 5 minutes to figure out how to put it back together again. Then you put the stand down, it falls over and a leg falls off again. Not sure why it's so hard, but it is! So, you just hold the thing and shoot people with it instead. The rockets were torn up pretty easily, but I'm not sure if that was from my dog or just normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bri

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor fun
customer_reviews.text: I was glad to see the extra rockets. It is easy for little ones to use. I bought it for my 3 year old nephew. He liked it but I think he was too little for it to hold his interest. If he had some one else to play with him using it he would have even liked it better. I have no problem with the product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Unique Gift
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for active kids! My son received this for his fourth birthday and loves it. He has some much fun seeing how high he can shoot the rocket. My daughter who is seven even has a blast with this! My biggest complaint is the stand. It doesn't hold together well and it a bit of a pain to put back together. Other then that, it's been a great toy for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Fun for whole family!
customer_reviews.text: They really do not glow, howevery I am giving this 5 stars because the kids loved it! 3 year olds to 15 year olds and adults gave it a go at our family 4th celebration. We ordered the glow in the dark version as a safe alternative to setting off fireworks for the small kids. The stand needs to be put back together after adult use, but I doubt it was designed for that anyways :-) *We used kite string to tie glow in the dark bracelets to each rocket. They launch just as far, and made them super easy to find*
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. As a gift or for yourself.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this is an amazing toy for kids of all ages. I gifted one to my 6-year-old, and kids from age 2 to 13 were enthralled with it. I wouldn’t bother getting the extra rockets, because it’s good for kids to run around and catch them (and for adults to figure out how to get them out of the gutters!). I highly recommend this for any gift of littles... even the adults will love stomping on it. Shoot, it might be the perfect gift for that someone who has everything: it’s compact and ridiculously amusing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Endless fun for kids -- but rockets can get lost
customer_reviews.text: This is a great outdoor toy for kids that does not take up too much space in your backyard or garage. Our kids love to launch the rockets and chase them in the yard, although they can easily get stuck in trees. I think the kids learn about using different strategies to launch the rockets to make them go higher or lower based upon how hard they step on the launcher. The rockets are made of soft foam so they are unlikely to cause any injury. Our kids and their friends absolutely love these rockets and it is easily one of their favorite outdoor toys -- plus, it is a simple and easy to store/clean toy as well
customer_reviews.author: Laura Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all ages
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the flimsy launcher is useless. That said, you really don't need it anyway. My 3 1/2 year old grandson loves this toy. As do my wife and I. Indoors or out, this keeps him busy. He likes to hold the business end and point the rocket in different directions and experiment with stomping harder or softer and see where the rocket lands. After a few practice trials, he had no trouble at all stomping on the base and getting of great launches. I like that the rockets are soft foam and completely safe. Great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Pete12345

customer_reviews.title: Fun product and easy to use but you need a bit of open space
customer_reviews.text: Great gift. I got this for my 3.5 and 5 year old daughters. They loved it. It took my younger one a bit of time to figure out the stomp because of the timing to jump on it with two feet at the same time (she was too tiny to make it go with a one foot stomp technique ) I gifted it to my children’s friends (boys) and they loved it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great, inexpensive toy that provides lots of fun for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great, inexpensive toy that provides lots of fun for little kids. When we first saw one at the park, several kids (including my 3 year old boy) were lining up to watch and ask for a turn. We had to get one of our own - my son loves it. However, I am knocking it down because the product itself is flimsy (but its cheap), and the box didn't include the wing nut that it needs to connect everything together (cost me $1 at our hardware store).
customer_reviews.author: ekoppp

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable gift for a young child
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is a bit cheap but I think it will hold up as long as my 5 year old nephew's attention span. He loved the toy and we enjoyed a nice moment firing it together in the driveway. Only goes about 25-30 feet up which is fine since I didn't want him losing the rockets. Older kids probably won't be impressed by its performance for long.
customer_reviews.author: Reece

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the yard
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 6 year old. He's a bit of a string bean, so he can't stomp all that hard. When I do, this thing really takes flight. I only gave it four stars because one of the rockets split after using it only a couple times. It's inexpensive, so I didn't expect it to last forever, but I thought it would at least make it a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep them busy!
customer_reviews.text: My son received this as a gift last year for his third birthday and still loves playing with it so much, I bought one for a friends kiddo for her birthday. So simple a small child can set up and play for hours. Great toy for when I need to get yard work done:)
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Fun but breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This is really fun for my kids and they like it a lot, but the rockets are super flimsy. 2 were broken before we even took it outside to play. It’s made of a thin material like pool noodles so it tore easily when my kids were inserting it onto the launcher.
customer_reviews.author: T. L.Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Rockets All Broke
customer_reviews.text: This toy was awesome and my grandchildren had a blast until each and every rocket broke. The Rockets need to be constructed much stronger so they don’t break. It’s really a shame because my grandchildren and all of their friends were having so much fun now they only have one rocket left.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen R.

customer_reviews.title: My Kid loves it but I hate it! Constantly comes apart
customer_reviews.text: My Kid loves it but I hate it! Constantly comes apart! I have to use rubber bands and tape to try and keep the stand together and the tube from coming out of the air bag. Not to mention the corrugated tube that feeds the air from the bag to the rocket is so rigid that when you do get the hunk of junk to stay together it falls over anyhow. Which means I spend more time trying to fix it and keep it upright than my kid plays with it and it is as frustrating as heck!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better mount
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids and I were excited to try out this stomp rocket for the first time. I had experience with one a few years back. This one's stand was flimsy and broke at each launch. The rocket would launch, but it didn't go very high, even with adults stomping on it. The plastic of the air bag probably won't hold up. I expected more the the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great For Toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my toddlers, who love to shoot big brothers Nerf guns (have trouble pulling the trigger and 2 year old almost took out an eye). These are a semi-good replacement. The newly turned two year has enough stomp power to shoot the rocket off after a couple of tries. The only issue is the X "base" that holds the rocket up keeps coming apart. Other than that, it's all good !
customer_reviews.author: Soda Star

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun but stand falls apart
customer_reviews.text: This little rocket is a lot of fun. It was a birthday gift for our 9 year old son. His older brother and sister love playing with him and his rockets. Only problem is the stand needs some Improving. We have a problem with ours staying together. I’m thinking we may have to go to the ol stand by “ duct tape.”
customer_reviews.author: A, Williams

customer_reviews.title: Bummed
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter and she absolutely loves it. But we can only use 1 rocket of the 4 that it came with. The other 3 were torn/ separated where the wing is attached to the white rocket part. When you stomp the air just comes out of those slots and doesn't shoot. The whole thing is pretty flimsy too but I'm more irritated that I have to tape the rockets in order for them to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie Kopp

customer_reviews.title: Jump, stomp and watch it go up! Tons of fun with the kids outside!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't go as high as some other stomp rocket units, but for younger kids it's still a ton of fun. Definately worth the price, we're going to see if we can purchase additional foam rockets because they can fall apart or get squished while everyone is running around having fun. Very enjoyable and good fun with the family!
customer_reviews.author: S. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: A fun toy for the kids.
customer_reviews.text: This gift was the best afternoon enjoyment for my grandkids. My grandkids are rough and a bit too rough for the toy. All darts had their fins torn off by the end of the day It was worth having them play and use up energy having so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Swank

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy!
customer_reviews.text: My two grandkids love playing with this toy. The 3.5-year-old loves to stomp and see how high she can get it. My 3-year-old doesn't understand that you can't push the rocket all the way down on the pipe and still be able to launch it. Maybe if there was a line on the pipe that shows kids how far to set the rocket they could better understand where it needs to sit in order to make it launch.
customer_reviews.author: Brrrrr

customer_reviews.title: Eh... good concept, bad design.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these, however, the stand that it goes on, keeps falling apart. I have to constantly keep putting it back together. The part where the "stomper piece" goes onto the tube kept falling off as well. I have since taped it together. As for being "glow in the dark," they are not. Not at all. This would be so much more fun if the base was a little bit larger and came as a collapsible design, instead of trying to save space/money/packaging and making the user assemble it, only for it to continuously fall apart again. With that being said, he really does enjoy playing with it, so I suppose I'll just keep putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: disappointing design flaws for a great toy concept
customer_reviews.text: Had a different version before that we loved then got this one- the base needs to be assembled and when handled by my 4 year old it always falls apart and requires adult intervention. Annoying. Plus the launcher angles beyond 90 degrees- maybe good for some but we wanted rockets that won't get stuck in trees so wanted it only angled straight up- again requiring significant adult intervention. Great concept, poor design. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: RachK23

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift
customer_reviews.text: It’s just like the one I had when I was little, and still so much fun. My 3 year old loves it. My only issues are that the stand needs re-assembled literally every time after launching a rocket, and the blue pieces come off the foam rockets very easily. Nothing a little tape and glue can’t fix, but still not convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all, but stand won't hold up.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my great nephew who's 3. It was perfect! He loved it. and so did his 14month old twin sisters. The only reason I only gave it 4 stars is that it is pretty cheap. It didn't stand up with out us holding it. The stand kept falling apart. An improvement there would be an A+
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Kuda

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described , easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, fair amount of power, it's nice that the kit includes additional rockets! My son loves. Unfortunately he figured out pointing the rocket and stomping. High powered enough that playing inside isnt as thrilling as stomping the rockets outside
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for 4 year old birthday
customer_reviews.text: Got this as present for my 4 year old. They loved it so much that I bought a few for other 4 year old bday parties. I also got feedback from those parents how much the kids liked it. It really doesn't look like much when you open it but really entertains the kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: runner_t

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, endless entertainment
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my toddler to use with his cousins. Their ages range from 2 to 14, and they all had a blast. After a day of practice, my toddler could load the rocket and stomp on it like a pro. Because the rockets are made of foam, we have even used them in the house. A great value for hours of entertainment!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S. Vander Plaats

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly simple and fun for inside (if you're ok with it hitting everything) ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our 3 year olds birthday present and he LOVES IT! As does our 5 year old daughter. Perfectly simple and fun for inside (if you're ok with it hitting everything) or outside. The only drawback is that the stand comes apart frequently and kids can't put it back together on their own, so I'm constantly fixing it. It stays together fine when I'm loading the rockets, I just wish it snapped together or something to make it more permanent for kid use.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: You can keep 1 1/2 - 3-year-old boys busy with this one.
customer_reviews.text: Each child can claim a rocket, stomp it off, and then run to get it. Just don't do the fetching, or he will have you trained in no time and won't get the exercise he needs. : )
customer_reviews.author: Ayla the Mensan Artist

customer_reviews.title: 6 yr old loved it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 6 year old nephew for Christmas and he loved it! It's a lot of fun, I even tried it out! The rockets can go pretty far up in the air! I would suggest using it in a court, at a park, or in an open field instead of a backyard. It seems like it could easily end up in the next door neighbors yard. This made a great gift. And the price was reasonable. If you found my review helpful, let Amazon know by hitting the "helpful" button.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Nicole

customer_reviews.title: 2 star to 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my 3 year old son and he absolutely loved it! However within a week of having the product half of the styrofoam darts broke. Customer service was great at handling the issue and sent us out 6 new darts free of charge! I couldnt be happier with how they handled the situation. Just keep in mind that these are delicate and can break easily.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Felton

customer_reviews.title: Fun entertainment
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 3 year old boy/girl twin grand children and was a huge success. Great way to give them exercise by jumping on base and running to retrieve the shot rockets. Easy to assemble and use. One rocket ended up on roof but it is possible to order more rockets separately, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona H.

customer_reviews.title: Way more fun than expected!
customer_reviews.text: See it in action!:  A safe, kid-powered rocket, that actually goes pretty high... this was a winner in our house! My six-year-old loves it because he can do everything himself; I love it because it wears him out! (After blast-off, he likes to try to catch the rocket as it falls.) The "stomp bag" is quite sturdy; it's stood up to quite a bit of abuse, even jumps from adults, with no indication of problems. The stand and hose are the only flimsy elements in the chain, but haven't failed us yet. I'd buy it again and/or happily purchase it as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Watson

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased about 6 of these so far, one for our own kids and the others as gifts. Kids have so much fun. We've even had a line of kids waiting their turn to use it. The fins have started to come off the rockets, but I was able to use a construction type glue to get them back on. Considering how flimsy the stand appears, it's still going strong. It is also difficult to get together at first and we ended up duck taping the stand together to prevent it from coming apart again. Annoying, but I can overlook considering how much fun kids (and adults) have with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plan to tape the stand - buy more rockets.  Great gift for 8 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Can only play with this inside right now, but it can work top shoot across the basement with ease. The tickets actuality fly very true. The stand is REALLY flimsy, so I'd recommend electrical/painter's tape to hold it together, duct tape would be a bit extreme and leave residue. The stand will keep falling apart and annoy the kids. Would recommend getting more rockets as 4 get launched super quickly. The dog HATES it as the air riding through the house must make a noise that's not ideal. Very cool gift!
customer_reviews.author: MaRx

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn't love rockets? Nobody that's who.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously this is a fun toy and you can stomp the crap out of this thing. When I play with the granddaughter we try to catch the rockets like baseballs it is a lot of fun. Not really accurate because they are foam, but if you use them as a firing squad you should plan on getting hit some.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great fun toy grandson loves
customer_reviews.text: very safe and easy toy my 3 year old grandson loves and his dad has fun too
customer_reviews.author: swb

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for 4 year old grandson
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 4 year old grandson for his birthday and he loved it! It was easy enough for him to use by himself (after using zip tie that other reviewers mentioned). I cannot speak of its longevity as we live in different states, but it was an absolute hit on the day I gave it to him. Good to wear off some excess energy!!
customer_reviews.author: Dorri

customer_reviews.title: Our go-to gift for the 4-6 year old range
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased several of these stomp rockets. This toy has become our go-to gift for young children. It's a very simple concept, but it is so much fun. Little kids will laugh and laugh. The toy is not so forceful that is has to be used inside. My kids have gone through two of these over the years, not because of poor quality, but because they played with it that much. The second one we purchased was another brand. We regretted that. Get the real stomp rocket for its ease of use and disability.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made but rocket flies high
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old cousin and he absolutely loves it!! I wish the construction was better. The stand is totally flimsy and difficult to get it set up because the plastic bends and it just falls over. I doubt it will last very long. He doesn't care though because the rocket flies sooo high. It was inexpensive so I guess you get what you pay for but I would've paid a few more dollars for a sturdy stand.
customer_reviews.author: JalynRose

customer_reviews.title: Great present for a 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: Great present for my 5 yo son, we loved playing with it too. He absolutely loved it and definitely the present he got the most out of. Highly recommend great value for money. It does got really high so best not to do it near the house. Our 2 yo twins were also able to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Gemma Carlaw

customer_reviews.title: Toddlers new favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. 2 year old loves it. Request to go outside to specifically play with this toy daily. I was curious why they sell replacement rockets. The rockets are reusable however the wings fall off quickly. Still works without the wings and can be glued back on of course.
customer_reviews.author: Mashelly27

customer_reviews.title: Best toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: From now until forever, if I am invited to a kids birthday party, or anything gift related, they will automatically get a stomp rocket! I have yet to see a child not go crazy over this toy! We even had our entire neighborhood entertained with this toy! I can't believe it is so cheap because the fun lasts for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: We've spent many days in the park with this item and it's loved by my kids
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the low price. We've spent many days in the park with this item and it's loved by my kids. Even withstands adults jumping on it occasionally. Only complaint is that the tripod (2 pieces you wedge together) come apart after every rocket launch. I finally just duct taped the legs together and it works fine - but it could use a better design on that portion. Still would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: thatoneguy

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, but came damaged
customer_reviews.text: Two of the four rockets had cuts or holes in them preventing them from working. I wasn't going to disappoint my 3 year old by packing it back up to return, so I had to purchase replacement rockets. It's a great toy. A little hard for my child to produce enough jumping power to make the rockets go very high, but he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: ablevins042906

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but quickly broke.
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun toy for a day or two, but it broke too quick. The air tube blew off the part you stomp on. We tried to hook it back together, but it still blows off about half the time. When the tube blows off, the rocket doesn't launch. Maybe we were a little rough with our stomping, but that's kind of the point when a toy like this.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Leeman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kids toy!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this thing. Great for outdoor entertainment or gifting.
customer_reviews.author: Lacy Baccari

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fun, great price
customer_reviews.text: We had the chance to play with this rocket stopper with rockets with some friends and my kids loved it. My kiddos are on the younger end but still at 2 & 4 were able to put the rockets on and stomp on the bottle with little to no help. We did this for hours. It was awesome. It's a kids toy so it's not made to last forever but it's holding up great with busy little fingers all over it. I would buy it again. And we may buy it for friends as gifts too.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: My 4yr received these for her birthday. And she loves them. For added fun we painted the rockets and have them compete ex red went so far/high! Ect. Major win for our family. And she was able to set it up herself super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Linsey Buchberger

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but forceful
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to write home about. A bit of a flimsy stand (even with tape). Kinda a prehistoric design all around..not easy for a 3 year old to get the “stomp” part into a flat position by himself without the whole base twisting and falling over. Maybe I’m just slightly a hater because my husband broke one of my hanging glass lanterns playing with this thing inside 😒 rockets definitely pack a punch
customer_reviews.author: Green Mountain

customer_reviews.title: The biggest surprise hit with our daughter.
customer_reviews.text: This was probably the best toy we've gotten for our 4 year old, ever. We had her 4th birthday party at our house this last summer and for the entire three and a half hour affair, this toy never had a break. By the end we were down to 1 rocket, as the rest had gotten stuck on the roof or in trees, but they all came back eventually...we still have all 4. Our daughter loves playing with it. Only drawback is that we have to help her keep the launcher steady because when they jump off onto the air pad, it tends to force the hose to wiggle enough to where it'll shake the launcher if it's not held.
customer_reviews.author: P. Deboer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best gift for kids (big and little)! As young as 2 years old all the way up through 60 enjoy this fun toy that encourages being outdoor and running around. I keep one in my gift closet because it’s a great gift for just about any child.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs B

customer_reviews.title: Fun- but the rockets don't glow in the dark
customer_reviews.text: It is simple to put together & use for a 5yr old. We had a lot of fun with it! Folds back up easily to store in the box neatly. The rockets really shoot high. Just slightly disappointed that the rockets didn't glow in the dark. Wiped the rockets with alcohol after neighbor kids joined us- wiped gently & didn't seem to cause any damage. Good, fun, simple gift! Good value too.
customer_reviews.author: mikki

customer_reviews.title: Good fun
customer_reviews.text: The boys had a great time. We were shooting them straight and seeing how could get it the highest. Shot them 45 degrees see who got them the furthest. Good time was had by all excluding me😆😆🤣
customer_reviews.author: JakeToby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids from 2 to 12
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our 3 year old son and it has been in regular rotation for 4 years so far. Any time it makes it to a playground, is is the most popular toy. We've gone so far as to make it a standard gift for his friends and each one has given rave reviews.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hynes

customer_reviews.title: Huge hit
customer_reviews.text: Nephew and niece didn't want to stop playing with this for days on end! So awesome to have a low-tech toy that requires going outside and gets everyone involved. Just as fun for the adults as it was for the kids! Just be careful of where you place it, we had to go on the roof/over the fence a couple times
customer_reviews.author: betweenthepages

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandkids to play at my house. They absolutely love it and played with it for a long time. The base is lightweight and kept falling apart so I used rubber bands to keep it together and the rockets fell apart after the first time using which is why 3 stars. Even though it has flaws I bought a second one because the kids enjoyed it so much. I explained how to handle the rockets so they didn't break and so far the second batch of rockets are holding up. It's fun to have two launchers as the grandkids launch them to each other from opposite sides of the yard. I would still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Paff

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my 3 year old’s previous stomp rocket (different brand) because we lost a piece of the old one. This quality was so poor! The pieces will not stay together and the rocket is too small (narrow hole) for the launcher. My son was getting so frustrated trying to put the rockets on and he couldn’t. I was so disappointed and missed the return window. I recommend searching for another brand!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Malone

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but 2 and 3 year old could not launch on their own
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this 3.5 stars. This was fun to play with as a family (neices would stomp with help from mom or dad, mom or dad and other neice would "catch"). However, I doubt many 2 year olds or 3 year olds can launch these unassisted. I doubt many under 5 years old can. Both of my neices, who are those ages and not small for their ages, could not launch these unassisted despite numerous attempts. It was still fun though.
customer_reviews.author: Kellyannam

customer_reviews.title: It was a hit!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3yr old nephew and it was a big hit! Several neighborhood kids came by to take a turn as well. Our only issue was setting up the stand that holds the tubing and the rocket. After it came apart for the third time, we just used duct tape and problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: JustDrea

customer_reviews.title: Good toy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun toy to take to the park. These rockets go really far and can be fun for the whole family. The rockets are light weight foam, so very little possibility of hurting anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Fairbanks

customer_reviews.title: Wings rip off easily
customer_reviews.text: A fun toy to play with! The only flaw is that the wings on the rockets rip off so easily. I haven’t tried glueing them back on but I hope that when I do, it doesn’t effect how they fly.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Olsen

customer_reviews.title: pieces does not fit properly to put it together
customer_reviews.text: my son was not able to try this out, it comes with 3 plastic pieces, there's one plastic piece that your supposed to put in the middle but there is no way to get it in, without breaking it, directions says leave enough space to insert the 3rd plastic piece. but there is no way to even leave enough space. waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it! Still weeks after Christmas...
customer_reviews.text: Son loves it. Safe for indoor/outdoor use. Was Christmas gift for destructive 5 year old. Now, towards the end of January it is the only gift (toy) that he is still playing with AND it is NOT broken yet!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Leos

customer_reviews.title: Two mins of fun before all the rockets were in neighbors yards!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it but be warned. I have a decent size yard and it only took 2 mins for the kids to shoot all 4 rockets into the neighbors yard. Perhaps fishing line attachment or something?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun but needs adult help
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fun product but it keeps popping apart. My kids would rate it a 5. If I had more patience and didn't mind fixing the base after every 5th or 6th stomp I too would give it a five. If you can teach your older kid how to reassemble the base you will love this toy. It has provided hours of fun. Adults and kiddos love seeing how far/high they can launch the arrows (which have held up well over time). You can use it for a science or math lesson as well. Great gift for a 4/5/6/7 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof3littles

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece
customer_reviews.text: This would have been great except the package arrived with a piece of the tripod missing. The 4yr old (who's birthday present it was) insisted on playing with it anyway, so we can't return it without lots of drama and huge disappointment - you can still use it, but someone has to hold it. It looks like a great product and I think I would have been very satisfied, if only it came with all the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnne Kuroczko

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift. The boys loved it even the bigger boys. It shoots really high and it's light so it falls back down light l y. Don't play near roofs and don't leave outdoors because the foam can rip
customer_reviews.author: JK

product_meta.title: Stomp Rocket Jr. Glow Rocket, 4 Rockets and Toy Rocket Launcher - Outdoor Rocket Toy Gift for Boys and Girls Ages 3 Years and Up
product_meta.description:
Edition:Jr GlowStomp Rocket Jr. Glow is 100% KID powered! Run, jump and STOMP to launch these rockets up to 100 feet in the air! All-foam Jr. Glow Stomp Rockets are great for younger kids. They glow in the dark and are perfect for fun during the day, after dusk and in gloomy weather too. Stomp Rocket Jr. Glow is strong and durable, and great for active, outdoor play. Stomp Rockets have won lots of awards from industry experts, including iParenting Media, Dr. Toy and Creative Child Magazine. Includes 4 all-foam glow-in-the-dark Stomp Rockets and a Stomp Launcher. Refill rockets also available (item #20015). For kids ages 3 and up.

AMAZON.COM
Kids can get rid of some excess energy with this air-powered outdoor rocket toy. No battery or fuel is needed to get the rockets airborne--just some old-fashioned stomping power. Set up the simple launch stand in a clear outdoor area, connect the 38-inch-long vinyl air hose and blast pad, load one of the 9-inch yellow foam rockets--and watch out. Our 5-year-old assistant reviewer really got a kick out of jumping on the purple blast-off pad and watching her rockets soar 50 feet or more, though she had to fight the adults for a turn. If the three rockets included with the kit aren't enough fun, you can order stomp parachutes and spin copters from the manufacturer. --Marianne Painter

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Stomp on the all foam rocket to send it up to 100ft in the air

See more
feature_bullets: Jr. Glow Stomp Rockets glow-in-the-dark, so they stand out against a dark sky!
100% KID powered: Run, jump and STOMP to launch these rockets up to 100 feet in the air!
All-foam rockets are great for younger kids — ages 3 and up and a solo play game
Includes a Stomp Launcher and 4 Jr. Glow Stomp Rockets.No batteries required; super easy, fast assembly

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars6,274 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
